p: The development of monoclonal antibodies, peptide-based and non-peptide small-molecule inhibitors of the PD-1/PD-1L pathway hold strong promise as effective beneficial immunodulators of CD8-mediated immune surveillance (9-11). Blockade of the PD-1 pathway in CD8+CD279+ subpopulation in vitro and in vivo has opened a new therapeutic avenue for abrogating functional exhaustion in these cells, and reinstating vigorous T cell cytotoxicity against the viral antigen [ 7- 11]. Reinvegoration of Tex may also be obtained by restoring effective CD28 co-stimulation [ 12], since PD-1 appears to directly target CD28 cytoplasmic tail [ 13].
